question.text: A uniform magnetic field is restricted within a region of radius,  r. The magnetic field changes with time at a rate, dB→dt. Loop one of radius R>r encloses the region, r and loop two of radius, R is outside the region of magnetic field as shown in the figure below. Then the emf generated is

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn></math> in loop one and zero in loop two.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> in loop one and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> in loop two.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> in loop one and infinite in loop two.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> in loop one and zero in loop two.

solution.text:
Magnetic flux linked with area of loop one is Bπr2.

So, emf in loop one is, -dB→dtπr2 .

Magnetic flux linked with area of loop two is zero.

So, emf in loop two is equal to zero.
